website_summaries.verdict: High quality product from a solid manufacturer. Easy to use unit for at-home use or contractors.
pros: Easy depth adjustment for countersinking or flush finish
Can use nails between 2 and 3.5 inches in length
Weighs only 7.5 lbs., weight balanced well throughout the tool for smooth performance
cons: Above average price point in framing nailer market

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my Bosstitch Nailer simply because the Hitachi nails are more readily available, cheaper and with wider variety. So far, the plastic collated nails seems to be reliable and the gun is working nicely. Better overall features than the Bosstitch, Th e only draw back is it requires more frequent re-loading since the plastic collated nails can't be densely packed like the wire ones. Amazon price was too good to pass up on this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Andari

customer_reviews.title: Great gun, lacks hook.
customer_reviews.text: This gun would get a 5 star if it had a built in hook. Another complaint that I have is it jams some time when using Grip-Rite 2-3/8 nails. Other than that this gun is very reliable and has no problem driving in nails. This is my third one of this model and I will continue to buy more. Hopefully one day they will surprise me with a hook.
customer_reviews.author: Teymur E.

customer_reviews.title: Great gun, but does sometimes struggle with the last nail
customer_reviews.text: Just finished Framing a house with this guy, Its definitely a very strong gun while still lightweight. Ive dropped it several times from significant heights and its still running perfectly. My only complaint is that it does have trouble with the last nail somewhat frequently. I find it will hit it in but leave the head out about a half inch almost every time (tried a couple different types of nails). But if you don't use the last nail, or slide in another clip before you get to the last few its usually not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Great Starts
customer_reviews.text: Good product and excellent distributor who got the Item here on time. Nailer is easy to use and to load. Directions are very clear. This item does load differently than previous nailers that I have had so be sure to read the instructions in case it is different for you too. In particular, you load the nails first, then pull the lever back, then allow it to slide forwardvalong the track behind the nails gently until it rests at the front of the cartridge. This is opposite of all the nailers I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not its fault
customer_reviews.text: This nailer replaced one that used paper tape for the nails. Nailer works great, but I'm not too keen on plastic instead of paper. The only reason I switched was that it was too hard to find 20 degree paper tape nails. Would strongly suggest you were eye protection with this gun...bits of plastic fly everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: gomer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I have done a lot of finish work and have all the nailers I need. But with some serious work to be done on our house, I knew I needed a framing nailer. Easy to use, and I really like the ease of toe nailing. The tip grabs on and, BAM, done. This has really helped to move my project along and saved a lot of wear and tear on my old arms.
customer_reviews.author: F. Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The NR90 AES1 is a nice nailer that performs as intended. I like the ability to switch out modes without tools. Works perfectly with my 3 gallon hitachi compressor. The only thing I don't like is the plastic stripped nails but this is not a hitachi issue. I looked at paper nailers but found that there was less options when buying nails locally compared to the 21degree nailers.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: This nailer is awesome. I had one jam and it cleared easily
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is awesome. I had one jam and it cleared easily, not sure what I did wrong to cause it. Solid, lightweight, much better than using a claw hammer -- especially overhead and between floor joists. Takes a variety of nail brands -- no need to stick to hard-to-find Hitachi nails. I've put over 1,000 nails through it already (had a lot of projects in the pipeline) and only the 1 misfire. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for small framing jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Ran 1500 nails through this on a pressure treated covered porch. First hour takes some adjustments on air and the little wheel for penetration depth, After that it's very productive. No jams. If you don't have the air filter/oiler/regulator, just put 5 drops of tool oil in the air intake every 4 hours and your good. Very precise at toe nailing on rafter and joist blocking. Drove this with a $150 Porter Cable compressor @ about 75 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Deacon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: I like this nailer. It does make sparks but some people say it will stop doing that after I break it in. The nails I bought have plastic between, so that is kind of messy. Not sure if the paper kind is compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Daviel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: Really good nail gun. I have a Bostich and Rigid framing gun, and for general use this is the best so far. Buy a rafter hook to make it even better, and a bag too. I would pay more if it came with those, and a soft tip for nailing trim!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lovering

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight for its size, and comfortable in use. Used this tool to build a 8x14 storage shed, and it worked like a champ, right out of the box with no adjustments and no hiccups. I bought this Hitachi based on the performance of my Hitachi brad nailer and was not disappointed. Best nailer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: fiddler chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great Hitachi product
customer_reviews.text: As usual, great nail gun, I have a couple of different ones and they are all great Hitachi. Have ran about 20 thousand nails through this one and only jammed once or twice and that was because it was the last nail and it went into the feeder on a angle. Very strong gun
customer_reviews.author: barbedwireart

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Feels great in the hand, nicely balanced. No jams. Consistent nail depth once you get it dialed in. Want to use it a few more months before I give it 5 *s, but I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I like this nailer. I've run about 2,000 12D smooth shank, and 4,000 8D ringshanks through it and haven't had a problem yet. It took a pretty good fall off a roof and got the tip plugged with mud, after cleaning it out it went back to work and didn't miss a beat.
customer_reviews.author: The Admiral JT

customer_reviews.title: Life changer
customer_reviews.text: Love, love it. Changed my world. Works effortlessly. Quality constructed, have had no hangs or miss fires. Have fired over 5 cases of nails.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL D.

customer_reviews.title: I bought the refurbished model. Using Hitachi nails, ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the refurbished model. Using Hitachi nails, I had one jam in 2400 nails. Set outlet pressure at 90+ to keep the nails feeding properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bad boy is a monster
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy is a monster. As a diy'r, this nail gun is great. Used on a couple of projects around the house. Don't be distracted when using. This is a serious tool. Shooting nails made easy. Chose the nails need and go to town. Able to finish job a little faster...
customer_reviews.author: xjfan

customer_reviews.title: Fraiming made easy.
customer_reviews.text: Made this job easier. No malfunction. Easy to operate. The guy I built these walls for went and bought one after I left.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, wife and I used for treehouse...
customer_reviews.text: Frame nailer, I love it, my wife loves it! We used it to build a treehouse and you wouldn't believe how much time this nailer saved. Great price, tons of nails available (here at Amazon) and the tool is VERY well balanced. What a great product!
customer_reviews.author: timmanch02

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Just a great reliable product. I purchased this nail gun and another brand at the same time for a house framing project. No comparison as this Hitachi nail gun totally out-shined the competition. Totally impressed!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Does its job and doesn't jam. I'm not a ...
customer_reviews.text: Does its job and doesn't jam. I'm not a full time contractor, but am in the middle of a renovation with a decent amount of framing that needs done. So far this gun has helped speed things up.
customer_reviews.author: Gillespie Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a cedar fence project. I did about 100 linear feet. It worked fantastic with no jams or misfires. I haven't done any major framing with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: MPDAD

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, light, effective.
customer_reviews.text: Put around 400 nails through this gun, I like it a lot. Very light, good depth adjustment, nails load easily. I'm using the hitachi nails, haven't tried other brands. I haven't had a single jam or misfire. Would be nice if it had a joist hanger but really it's a great product either way.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have had these before and they are great! I bought this one to nail the 300 feet of fencing I I put up. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Great Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This nail gun has worked flawlessly since I pulled it from the box.It is lightweight and makes the job much easier. I'm a little disappointed it didn't come with a carrying case.But the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebu

customer_reviews.title: The best hands down
customer_reviews.text: I have used many brands and Hitachi nail guns are the best you can get and this one is a perfect solid build and not super heavy
customer_reviews.author: Kevsac916

customer_reviews.title: It’s a rowdy no frills nail gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair to replace an older Senco. They are loud and they get the job done. Excellent gun for the price and no issues. They are a no frills nail banger.
customer_reviews.author: torsten palm

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight ust make sure you take some time to adjust so nails go in correct
customer_reviews.author: Jena Roop

customer_reviews.title: Not a tool for ladder or scaffold work
customer_reviews.text: Misfires constantly, last nail always goes in sideways and has to be pulled, plastic spacers between nails means only two ribbons at a time, no rafter hook is a deal buster! This one will sit at the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Cleaver

customer_reviews.title: Get the best gun
customer_reviews.text: So sweet. Full head nails, up to code. Strong gun. Why screw around? Just get the best gun. Google it
customer_reviews.author: steve carlson

customer_reviews.title: It worked great and was easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert. In fact I bought this for my first-ever nail gun experience ever. Framing a basement. It worked great and was easy to set up and use. The nails and compressor I bought on amazon worked well together.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: What can I say works perfect. I’ve put a couple hundred nails through it, bought from HFT, ant not one misfire. So far so good I love it. Using for home renovation purposes not professionally if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: Im used to the all metal guns so this one was a pleasant surprise on how light weight it is
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: so far good. I am a contractor and use nail guns alot. this one seems like its the homeowner model but performs just like my 600$ hitachi
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Started to go cheap on a nail gun , but why , when for a few dollars more you can get the best , buy this one , it's great
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift for my Dad which made it worse. Not shown as refurbished anywhere in the description
customer_reviews.text: Nail gun came refurbished. Thought i was getting a new produce. Was a gift for my Dad which made it worse. Not shown as refurbished anywhere in the description. Will be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and great for framing
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and great for framing. Can't imagine using a hammer to do all framing I had to do for a remodel.
customer_reviews.author: Cubano

customer_reviews.title: Lightest most compact framing nail gun I have ever
customer_reviews.text: Lightest most compact framing nail gun I have ever used

customer_reviews.title: This is a great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great nail gun. It's easy to load and has plenty of driving force for 3.5" nails.
customer_reviews.author: J-S

customer_reviews.title: BOOYAH
customer_reviews.text: Yeah buddy!! Pop Pop Pop POPpoppop... This will make your balls drop. Mine finally did at age 35. Thanks Hitachi!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Koleas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Used it to build a 12' X 12' shed in the back yard. Saved wear and tear on tired old body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a dream. I have only used it a couple of times, but it has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade Now!
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready to build our shop. Love this light weight nail gun will make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you will love it
customer_reviews.text: I framed out a kitchen with no problems. Nice and light.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the handyman.
customer_reviews.text: Have completed two projects without a single misfire or any other problem.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gun
customer_reviews.text: Great gun. I have used 3 1/2 and 2 inch in the gun and it is just great.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy one for half the price but my friends talked me out of it and I'm glad.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As with my other Hitachi nailers it works reliably and without fail when I need it..

customer_reviews.title: That the brand speaks for itself
customer_reviews.text: I use it for carpentry everything I build around the house
customer_reviews.author: armando herrera

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, although I have not had the opportunity to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: I am happy I picked this nail gun!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the gun worked flawless. No jams, shoots all nails in the sleeve, and the counter sink adjustment is easy on the fingers to adjust. The action of the slide is smooth. I would recommend this product to a fellow contractor or anyone that needs a solid nail gun for a projects around the home or farm!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! Great framing gun for reasonable price!

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is great, I loved how it functions, consistent nail depth, light weight. Only wish it came with a rafter hook, but those are cheap and easy to add to an otherwise great nailer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, only wish it came with a stud hanger.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: I've shot some other nailers in the past, but the Hitachi brand is the lightest, sturdy, smooth, and comfortable unit I've handled. Zero set up and starting nailing right out of the box!! Very nice product- generally I control my depth of nail head by controlling air pressure and testing on some scrap wood. So I have not tried playing with the manual knob adjustment provided- but it seems like a nice feature to have.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable!!
customer_reviews.text: Used on 2 construction jobs so far and works great...

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Nail Gun
customer_reviews.text: Incredible lightweight and high quality nail gun for the price compared to the Dewalt which I rented from Home Depot as I do not use one that often. But for the price I'd figured I'll buy this one. Great investment.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Relatively light but powerful nail gun, does a great job on toe nailing...

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi Bullet tough!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi is a beast ..Shot prob 150 nails , not one jam... Don't buy harbor freight or other junk...... I know that's not many... The harbor freight ones would have jammed ten times by then....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Put the hammer down.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been a caveman. For decades I wanted to drive the nails with my own might. But I had a big job upcoming and my physical hammering skill is now a bit "older." So I read some reviews and reluctantly bought this. It is my first air nailer and I've done a lot of construction before. Using this air nailer on a bathroom remodel was a fantastic experience. My speed and accuracy for nailing results were improved significantly. The feel and sound of the gun empowered me. The product worked way beyond my expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the price. Used it extensively after purchasing with zero jams and very minimal issues. Would definitely for recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this nail gun. A little cheaper than the rest. It is working good.

customer_reviews.title: Fits european nails from 50mm to 90mm. Fits the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits european nails from 50mm to 90mm. Fits the european pneumatic connections. That's not a DIY tool, that is a pro tool with 5 years guarantee. Less expensive than a gas nailgun.

customer_reviews.text: Putting plywood on my home and it's saved me alot of time.THANKS

customer_reviews.text: Well made , easy loading, very little kickback. I love it.

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi Quality
customer_reviews.text: Just had a chance to use it for the first time -- ordered it to replace a different brand that did not really hold up. Great nailer and perfectly factory set up for nail depth etc. Very pleased with it - light and feels good in your hand. would highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: ... slip back into single fire mod I have had better luck the other brand but still using it had ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job it jams every so often and the repeat fire mode likes to slip back into single fire mod I have had better luck the other brand but still using it had for 6 months it does the job. Almost all my air tools are Hitachi and I am a contractor all the other tool work great I just wonder if I got a bad gun or this model has problems

customer_reviews.text: I anxiously awaited my new nail gun. I had a DeWalt framing nailer that I thought was great but it broke and having it repaired became a nightmare. I did a lot of research on the internet about the best framing nailer for the money and Hatachi consistently came up. DeWalt wasn't even in the running. This thing is very powerful. The product is great, the price was great and the delivery was great...

customer_reviews.title: Great value and an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a daily user of this nail gun, but I've used it quite a bit and it's great! Not too heavy, well balanced, works well with my little Porter Cable pancake compressor. Wish I had a nice case or custom pouch to keep it in...

customer_reviews.title: Should've bought one years ago. I have a 25 ...
customer_reviews.text: Should've bought one years ago. I have a 25 year old bostitch that really needed replacing because I got tired of following up with a hammer. The only thing wrong is it doesn't have a hanger on it.

customer_reviews.title: A quality tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my first framing nailer. I have finish and brad nailers. I bought it for a garage construction project. I wavered between buying a low-cost nailer from Harbor Freight and something better. After reading reviews, I decided that it was worth the money for the Hitachi. the Nailer works very well in both single-fire and bump-fire modes. It is light weight, has good balance, a solid feel and, so far, it has not jammed once. The one negative is that it doesn't come with a molded case.
customer_reviews.author: Bunkie

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer, great price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Some people do not like plastic collated nails but not a problem for me. The exhaust never hits you it is light and powerful. I have trouble finding nails for it in my town so I drive to Cheyenne
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Adjustable Trigger
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is very nice in several respects such as weight, quality material and feel, price, adjustable trigger, etc. I really like the adjustable trigger just by flipping a switch to single fire or bump fire. The only issue I've had is the nailer doesn't seem as powerful as others I've used in the past. When driving 3.5 inch nails there have been several times I've had to finish driving with a hammer in typical pressure treated wood. These are the longest nails, with a .131 inch diameter, but not the thickest. Not sure if this improves with a break-in period, but hopefully it will as this is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Features but check the nail clip holder
customer_reviews.text: This model has nice features and no tool adjustments, but the spring guide that the holds the nail clips works loose and causes jambs. Went through 4 clips and had three jambs. May be a spring defect, but check it close. Other reviews sounded good. My Chinese 3 in 1 nailer did a better job for consistency and for about 100.00 less.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Counts

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and buy the NR83a3 instead!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad tool! Fires every time, Had an issue with the item looking used and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: T7

customer_reviews.title: Broke the 2nd time we used it...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Gift at Christmas time we are now in April and it's been used twice and it BROKE! I can't return it since its beyond my 30 day window but doesn't seem fair that it BROKE with minimal use. Moving forward gotta buy tools only at Home Depot or a source where there will take it bak in this scenario. It's not right.
customer_reviews.author: America F.

customer_reviews.title: not as good as my old gun
customer_reviews.text: This brand is great this gun still jams not as good as my old gun fast reload though I do you like that
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

product_meta.title: Hitachi NR90AES1 Framing Nailer, 2-Inch to 3-1/2-Inch Plastic Collated Full Head Nails, 21 Degree Pneumatic, Selective Actuation Switch, 5-Year Warranty (Discontinued by the Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: The NR90AE(S1) framing nailer drives plastic collated nails from 2" to 3-1/2" in length and features Hitachi's next generation "Industrial Design". The newly redesigned head guard allows for a faster and easier disassembly process, saving you valuable time during tool maintenance. The NR90AE(S1) weighs only 7.5 pounds, making it easy to use all day, while still providing the power of bulkier, heavier nailers. A selective actuation switch adds the convenience of being able to quickly change between bump or sequential fire and the tool-less depth of drive eliminates the need to adjust the pressure at the compressor. The simple two-step loading makes fastener replenishment quick and easy, reducing downtime. Includes Safety Glasses (875769). Air Pressure PSI: 70 – 120, Air Consumption @ 100 PSI scfm .09, Applicable Nails Diameter in: .113 – .148, Length in: 2 – 3-1/2, Nail Capacity: 64 (.131), Magazine Angle: 21 Degrees, Magazine Loading: Rear, Actuation: Selective, Depth Adjustment: Tool-less, Jam Clearing: Open Nose
feature_bullets: Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT. Same great tools, with only a new name.
New head guard design allows for quicker disassembly during tool maintenance
Lightweight and well balanced for ease of maneuverability and less user fatigue
Selective actuation allows for quick changes between sequential and contact nailing with the flip of a switch
